general.headline: Partner | Commercial Disputes | Regulatory & Investigations | Insolvency & Restructuring
general.description:
I am an experienced commercial litigator specialising in complex commercial disputes, competition and consumer law claims and regulatory actions, and corporations law proceedings. My competition and consumer law practice has a particular focus on franchising law and regulation, restrictive trade practices and anti-competitive conduct, the trade conduct protections, advertising and marketing, and consumer guarantees. I also act in corporate and personal insolvency litigation and advise corporate clients in non-contentious insolvency and restructuring matters.

I take a measured and commercially pragmatic approach, working closely with my clients to develop strategies for the early and cost-effective resolution of disputes, to handle regulatory compliance issues, and to respond to investigations and inquiries.  I regularly advise and appear for clients in matters before superior state and federal courts and tribunals, in arbitrations, mediations, and expert determinations, and before regulators, drawing on over 11 years’ experience handling high-stakes litigation and large-scale regulatory investigations and proceedings.

I work with Australian and multinational corporates in a wide range of industries, including  retail/FMCG, food, telecommunications, media, mining, energy, entertainment, travel and tourism, petroleum, and personal and financial services industries.  I also act for insolvency practitioners, company directors, and a number of high-profile and high net worth individuals.  

Previously, I was a commercial litigator with Gilbert + Tobin, including a period on secondment to Telstra's regulatory affairs team advising on the rollout of the NBN, and acted for a number of prominent Australian, New Zealand and multinational corporations in commercial litigation and trade practices matters at Bell Gully in New Zealand's leading litigation and regulatory practice - principally for clients in the aviation and forest products industries.

general.headline: CEO Australia @ Grameen Australia | Board Director @ Food Frontier | Creator @ F-OFF: Fear of Failure Forum
general.description:
Who am I?  The best way to find out is through Karma:

https://karma.wiki/app/secure/user/bio:auth0%7C589948dddd23ad6ee0b6958d/biography/received

I lead Grameen Australia's strategy and operations in Australia. We help the world’s poorest - especially women - gain access to financial services. Our mission is to usher in a world of three Zeroes (Zero Poverty. Zero Unemployment. Zero Emissions) through social business.

Grameen Bank was founded by Nobel Peace Prize winner, Professor Muhammad Yunus. Grameen Foundation Australia is a wholly-owned Australian entity that adopts the Grameen microfinance model and the principles of Yunus Social Business.

Our vision is to live in a financially & socially inclusive economy in which all humans lead dignified, meaningful lives.

Our projects are in The Philippines and Cambodia. In 2018, we are expanding into Australia, starting with regional NSW.

Frustrated with fixed-mindsets in organisations, I created F-OFF: Fear of Failure Forum, a movement that explores our fear of failure, why it holds us back and offers strategies to grow our potential (f-off.org). 

I started my career as a lawyer and am a writer for and ambassador of tech media company, Ideapod.

Speaking: NEXUS Australia Youth Summit, AFR Innovation Summit, Telstra's Brilliant Connected Women, ModelOff @ Microsoft, UTS Business School, Perpetual Potential Symposium, CBA Innovation Lab, Responsible Lending & Borrowing Summit.

Background: law, social business, development, leadership, advocacy, funds, aviation, global transactions, strategy, cultural change, M&A/PE/VC, technology, stand-up comedy, philosophy & creative production.

Follow me: katdunn.com | ideapod.com/katdunn | f-off.org | twitter.com/kat_dunn_01

jobs.description:
Non-Executive Board Director of protein innovation company, Food Frontier, which
      advocates for healthier people and a healthier planet via plant-based meat and clean
      meat. It is ushering in the future of food, building an ecosystem of food innovators and
      
      helping incumbents adopt the cutting edge of food production technology.

Grameen Australia is leading the way in the development of Social Businesses to provide employment for the poor and give them the skills and financial responsibility to escape poverty permanently.

Historically, Grameen Australia is inspired by, and is an independent replication of, Grameen Bank. In 2006, Grameen Bank was jointly, with its founder Professor Muhammad Yunus, awarded the 2006 Nobel Peace Prize for lifting millions of people out of poverty through microfinance.

Our vision is to create an economically and socially inclusive world in which all humans lead dignified meaningful lives. Our mission is to play a significant role in ushering in a world of three zeroes – zero poverty, zero unemployment and zero emissions. Our strategy to 2020 is to develop and grow social business in Australia and South East Asia.

We have projects in The Philippines, Cambodia and are exploring the viability of a microfinance intervention in Australia.

We employ 60 people in The Philippines, 20 people in Cambodia and have 4 members of the Executive team who oversee the implementation of our projects and who are responsible for fundraising, community building, operating the Group and advocacy.

Do you want to grow your potential, innovate, create and unleash your industrious, resourceful, entrepreneurial spirit? Yet you feel held back by your fear of failure? You identify as a high achiever so you believe that setbacks or failures compromise that story:

Me too.

F-OFF is a movement that explores our fear of failure, why it holds us back and strategies to grow our potential. 

We value a growth and innovative mindset, authentic and purpose-led leadership, personal development and genuine human connection. 

Many people suffer from a fear of failure but don't explore it. This doesn't solve the problem - it leads to isolation and suffocation of potential. It can even result in unintended outcomes in the workplace, like fearful people hiding mistakes, leaders seeing risks that aren't there and talented people missing opportunities to grow & develop their potential. 

It disconnects and stunts social evolution. Fear of failure curbs learning and society becomes collectively stagnant.
 
F-OFF brings together ambitious, high potentials across multiple domains to explore failure as a tool for high performance. 

We want to inspire a connected world that re-frames failure as a tool for personal and social growth - using a growth mindset and gratitude to overcome setbacks & challenges - so we can collectively get on with the business of contributing our best selves to the world and each other.

See our work at f-off.org

Ideapod is a tech company that produces media that ushers in the ideas that will shape the future. We run media site The Power of Ideas and social network, Ideapod.com - a platform for humans to connect around ideas.

We are a portfolio company of 37 Angels in New York City. We have partnerships with Mindvalley Academy, Educate Inspire Change and Goalcast.

Technology is advancing at an exponential rate. If we continue on our current path, we risk becoming its slaves. The way forward is to empower humans to share their ideas - our ideas give birth to creation, invention and innovation and will enable us to build a brighter awe-inspiring future together.

Influencers and partnerships include Sir Richard Branson, Maria Shriver, Jason Silva, Marianne Cantwell, Dr Alan Dupont. Clients include Australian bank CBA Innovation Lab, think tank ADC Forum, kidtech wearable brand Kiddo and partnerships include Virgin Group, United Nations Population Fund, New York Ideas, Aspen Institute and the Democratic National Convention Committee.

Perpetual Limited is an ASX100 fund manager with a market cap of around $2b and 900+ employees in Australia and Singapore.  

In FY16, Perpetual launched its Lead & Grow strategy with Improvement as a key enabler. 

As the founding program leader, Kat led a cultural revolution, to drive an enterprise-wide innovative and growth-mindset & using open-innovation methods through campaigns & cross-divisional workshops. 

We partnered with The Bevington Group to knowledge transfer the principles of Lean. In 10 months, the program delivered:

- 18+ major projects across each division (exceeding plan)
- soft-dollar savings of $1m+ 
- 630+ people trained in Lean (76%+ of org in 10 months)
- idea gen tools & campaigns across the Group (ahead of plan) including the "Make Things Better" campaign which generated over 107 ideas & stories, 300+ user registrations, 125 comments and 800+ votes (Open innovation)
- an inspired community that champions improvement at a local level

Accelerated progress in FY16 enabled us to front run tactical activity from FY17 and FY18, creating best in breed capability.

    - People Connect (employee contracts, workplace law policies and procedures)
      

    
      - Work Health & Safety

Founding lawyer in National Corporate Practice Group. Involved in all areas of the business including managing juniors and business development. Advised on structuring start-ups, VC/PE deals, complex M&A and due diligences, ECM, funds/FSR, ESOPs and restructuring. 

Played a critical part in designing & delivering the inaugural Australian Growth Company Awards and authored chapters in the 2014 Australian Private Equity Handbook by Nick Humphrey, National Head of Corporate.

Well-rounded litigator, advocate & legal adviser on commercial, media and cross-border transactions (European focus).

Built trust with and closely managed offshore legal teams across Europe, UK and USA and engaged daily with C-level stakeholders and advisers to complete $300m sale of SAE (School of Audio Engineering) & Qantm College to Navitas Limited through a competitive bid process. 

Regularly appeared in the Supreme Court of NSW and instructed barristers in commercial and equity litigation.

Involved across all areas of business development and worked as a consultant to the firm during a period of extended leave whilst travelling from July 2011 to February 2012.

Completed the summer clerkship program and worked full-time as a structured capital markets paralegal throughout final year of law school. Completed graduate program across Corporate, Banking & Financial Services and Litigation groups and acted on numerous transactions including RMBS private placements for Macquarie Securitisation, Suncorp-Metway and Bendigo & Adelaide Bank. 

Acted for the Minister for Immigration for 8 months and litigated in the supreme and federal courts of Australia successfully running an admin law practice of 50+ matters as a junior lawyer. 100% track record of obtaining orders sought.

Achieved consistent positive feedback from clients for commerciality, efficiency and outstanding advice/service. Represented Clayton Utz in the NSW Young Lawyers' Golden Gavel Competition and 3 x 100km Oxfam Trailwalker events over 3 years.

ALSA is the peak body representing around 30,000 Australian law students. Strategic decisions are made by a national Council comprised of representatives from each law student society. Day to day affairs are managed by an annually elected Executive & Committee on which Kat served as Immediate Past-President, President, Vice-President (Finance & Marketing), Vice-President (Administration) and Council Member for the Murdoch Student Law Society during 2003-2007.

general.headline: Senior Lawyer at Rydge Evans Lawyer
general.description:
I am a Senior Lawyer with Rydge Evans specialising in dispute resolution, litigation and intellectual property. I have over 10 years’ experience in commercial dispute resolution and litigation during which time he has dealt with a wide range of matters acting for both Australian and international clients in a range of industries. This includes pharmaceuticals, fashion, homewares, information technology, hospitality and government.

I have a Bachelor of Arts, a Bachelor of Laws and a Masters of Applied Law (Commercial Litigation), and is a Notary Public.

I previously practised in the Sydney offices of both national and international law firms. These include DibbsBarker, DLA Piper and Sparke Helmore. In these roles I acted in a broad range of commercial, competition and intellectual property matters involving contractual issues, claims under the Australian Consumer Law, trademarks, copyright and patents. I am listed as being Recommended for Intellectual Property & Technology Law in The Legal 500 Asia Pacific 2018.

I am committed to achieving the best possible outcomes for clients as quickly and efficiently as possible, while being mindful of their commercial imperatives and financial considerations.

jobs.description:
A Senior Lawyer with Rydge Evans specialising in dispute resolution, litigation and intellectual property. I has over 10 years’ experience in commercial dispute resolution and litigation during which time I have dealt with a wide range of matters acting for both Australian and international clients in a range of industries. This includes pharmaceuticals, fashion, homewares, information technology, hospitality and government.

I have a Bachelor of Arts, a Bachelor of Laws and a Masters of Applied Law (Commercial Litigation), and is a Notary Public.

I previously practised in the Sydney offices of both national and international law firms. These include DibbsBarker, DLA Piper and Sparke Helmore. In these roles I acted in a broad range of commercial, competition and intellectual property matters involving contractual issues, claims under the Australian Consumer Law, trademarks, copyright and patents. I am listed as being Recommended for Intellectual Property & Technology Law in The Legal 500 Asia Pacific 2018.

I am committed to achieving the best possible outcomes for clients as quickly and efficiently as possible, while being mindful of their commercial imperatives and financial considerations.

I regularly advise clients on various intellectual property issues including development, protection and enforcement of intellectual property rights in Australia, and internationally.

Matters I have been involved in include:
Acting for a government agency in relation to patent licencing issues regarding various pharmaceuticals and generic formulations.

Acting for Nuplex Industries, a leading global manufacturer of polymer resins, in Federal Court and Full Federal Court proceedings, and High Court of Australia Special Leave in which Nuplex was successful on re-trial in upholding the original decision that liability had not been established (Siegwerk Australia Pty Ltd (in liquidation) v Nuplex Industries (Aust) Pty Ltd [2016] FCA 158).

Acting for Robert Cummings, Tanmari Pty Ltd and FrameCAD IP Ltd in copyright infringement proceedings against JR Consulting & Drafting Pty Ltd, Hayes Steel Framing Systems Pty Ltd and Steel Framing Systems International Pty Ltd.  The decision was appealed and the appeal dismissed by the Full Federal Court of Australia (JR Consulting & Drafting Pty Ltd & Anor v Cummings [2016] FCAFC 20).

Acting for the inventor of over 600 medication management systems in a range of intellectual property disputes, including patent and trade mark infringement, and obtaining injunctive relief against infringers.

Advising a leading psychometric assessment provider in a dispute arising from a master licence with distributors. A mandatory injunction to transfer the domain name was obtained on an interlocutory basis  (see Thomas International Limited v Humantech Pty Ltd [2015] FCA 541)

Acting for a multi-award winning wedding dress and formal-wear designer in brand protection and copyright enforcement matters in both Australian and international jurisdictions.

Acting for a global packaging company in Federal Court of Australia proceedings on appeal from a decision of the Patents Office.

IP & Technology Team

Acting for a major Commonwealth Government agency in Federal Court of Australia and Copyright Tribunal proceedings arising from alleged breaches of a software licencing agreement.  This involved extensive examination of computing infrastructure and technical limitations imposed by hardware and software within the agency over a period of time, analysis of software distribution policies and review of contract interpretation laws in the United States of America.

Acting for a leading global manufacturer of polymer resins in relation to a range of Trade Mark and commercial disputes including Federal Court proceedings arising from allegations of contractual breach, product liability and insurance contract interpretation.

Acting for the operator of a buying group of over 1,000 pubs and bottleshops under a number of industry leading brands in relation to Trade Mark and general commercial disputes.

Acting for the world's largest manufacturer of electrical heating in Federal Court Proceedings concerning alleged infringement of section 13 of the Patents Act 1990 (Cth).

Acting for a leading British-based hotel business, owning or operating over 120 hotels in 19 countries around the world, in relation to Federal Court proceedings arising out of a Trade Mark dispute with a hotel operator in Melbourne, Victoria.

Acting for a regional airline serving Malaysia and south-east Asian destinations in relation to internet domain name disputes.

Acting in Federal Court of Australia proceedings for one of the sixth largest coatings companies in the world arising from alleged breach of contract and misuse of confidential information.

Broad range of commercial litigation and dispute resolution including:

Acting for Al Jadeed TV, a Lebanese television broadcast station, in Federal Court proceedings concerning intellectual property rights and alleged breaches of Consumer Protection Legislation.   Successfully obtained judgment in favour of the client on issues of contractual termination for material breach, inability to perform material obligations and material misrepresentations (Al Jadeed TV v United Broadcasting International Pty Limited [2011] FCA 983)

Acting for a European consumer goods manufacturer in Federal Court proceedings arising from disputed intellectual property rights and alleged conduct in contravention of Trade Practices legislation.  

Acting for an Australian veterinary pharmaceutical manufacturer in Federal Court proceedings in respect of alleged conduct in contravention of Trade Practices legislation and involving expert evidence on disease etiology, drug design and manufacture.  

Acting for an international consumer goods company in relation to dealings with the Australian Competition and Consumer Goods Commission (ACCC) arising from the issue of a notice pursuant to section 155 of the Trade Practices Act (now Australian Consumer Law).

Acting for major listed diversified property trusts in a range of property related disputes including leasing and make-good obligations, arrears of rent, bank guarantee provisions and termination clauses.

Acting in proceedings involving urgent interlocutory applications including an application for freezing orders arising out of fraudulent withdrawal of caveats over property valued at $3 million (AUD). 

Acting for an international confectionary company, together with its Australian and United Kingdom subsidiaries in Federal Court proceedings in relation to intellectual property rights, alleged conduct in contravention of Australian Trade Practices legislation and contractual breaches of a distribution agreement.

Acting for major banking and financial institutions on litigation arising from commercial and private finance arrangements.

Acting and advising on a range of matters including issues arising from Consumer Credit Code, Contracts Review Act and Farm Debt Mediation Act.

General office administration including taking instructions from new and existing clients, file management and accounting.

Primary focus on litigation across a broad range of jurisdictions including Local, District and Supreme Courts.

general.headline: Chief Marketing Officer at Deloitte Australia
general.description:
As Creative Director, Managing Director, CEO and Chairman, I have spent more than 25 years at the helm of Australia’s leading advertising agencies.  
 
I’ve been proud to receive several accolades for my focus on outstanding creativity and ideas, including two Grand Prix Awards at the Cannes International Advertising Festival as Executive Creative Director. Nothing gives me more pride in my career than seeing people I lead go on to huge success themselves and become leaders in their fields. 
 
Growing businesses is what drives me and I’m a firm believer that the only way to do that is to build high performing, talented teams. Bringing young talent on board, overseeing their development and then watching the impact they are having in Australia and around the globe has been my proudest professional achievement. 
 
Working with clients like Telstra, Optus, Suncorp and many others is something I have loved, building their business with creative ideas. Recently, I’ve enjoyed projects in digital media for realestate.com.au to refocus their marketing, and as Chief Brand Officer, helping Network Ten rebuild their audience and grow it by 25% over three years.
 
A new arrival into the world of professional services, I plan to make an impact that matters by using my experience to help the Deloitte brand better reflect the big thinking, bright ideas and difference that are the core of how we work. Bringing big creativity to a Big 4 firm and a focus on big results is my goal. 
 
Ask me about: advertising, leadership, great content, social media, cinema and long distance running  
Don’t mention: why I had to give up coffee, accounting, or computer coding.

jobs.description:
Matt formulated and presented the strategy to the Board for the rebuilding of Network Ten business working with PWC. This entailed a complete review of TV audiences, technological change, trends in free to air content, Ten's previous strategies, advertiser integration and sales opportunities, and marketing and promotion to rebuild the Ten network brands. 

These changes have resulted in the turnaround of Ten's audiences for the first time since 2011. 

Matt has successfully launched 5 successful new franchise launches in 2015 as well as generating significant growth in key existing franchises. 

Plus Ten has dominated it's competitors 7, and 9 in the Broadcasting Industry's Promax Awards, and achieved the highest levels of social media engagement for it's entertainment and Event TV content often trending worldwide for program launches. 

The repositioning and relaunch of the network has resulted in Network Ten being the only network to grow in 2015.

jobs.description:

This involved all disciplines of general marketing and business development, including: external communications, PR, media, digital (web and social media) strategies, brand awareness, advertising, CRM, campaigns, graduate recruitment, events, sponsorships, winning business and internal communications.

general.headline: Chairman at PremierState
general.description:
Michael Photios is the Chairman of PremierState, a leading corporate advisory and public affairs consultancy based in New South Wales.

First elected to the NSW Parliament in 1988, Michael went on to serve in the NSW Parliament for over a decade. As Minister for Multicultural and Ethnic Affairs and Minister Assisting the Justice Minister, Michael was the then youngest ever Cabinet Minister in Australia. Prior to this, Michael served as Chairman of the NSW Government Environment Committee, and the powerful Public Accounts Committee.

In opposition, Michael served in the senior Cabinet portfolio. As Shadow Minister for Transport, he played a key role in advising and scrutinising rail reform across NSW, and keenly promoted the role of PPPs in service delivery. As one of the first advocates of an integrated transport management system in NSW, Michael was instrumental in ensuring its inclusion into the Coalition’s policy platform and current reform agenda.

As Shadow Minister for Tourism, Michael was arguably the most vocal partner for the NSW tourism industry. Amongst other achievements, he was mastermind of the successful sleep-out in Parliament, protesting against a proposed NSW bed tax.

After retiring from Parliament in 1999, Michael established the government advisory firm MP Consulting. In this capacity, he worked for more than a decade with a range of major private sector corporations and public sector agencies. A regular presenter on ABC TV’s “Newsmakers”, Michael continues to contribute to the national conversation surrounding public policy settings and issues.

A former NSW Liberal Party Vice President, Michael has served on the State Executive alongside State and Federal Leaders. Michael also serves on the Board of the Liberal Forum, contributing to NSW policy development and was recently a key member of Barry O’Farrell’s Agenda 2011 Committee, where he assisted on the development of campaign strategy for winning Government.

general.headline: Chief Executive Officer at The Law Society of New South Wales and Secretary-General and CEO, LAWASIA
general.company: The Law Society of New South Wales
general.description:
Michael Tidball was appointed Chief Executive Officer of the Law Society of New South Wales in 2006. In recent years, he has also concurrently served as Secretary General of LAWASIA.

Michael Tidball has worked in both government and business sectors, working in strategic management and senior advisory roles. He has also served as Special Advisor to the Public Accounts Committee of the New South Wales Parliament. 

Mr Tidball has a strong background in professional services and legal sector administration. He was appointed Chief Operating Officer of the Law Society of New South Wales in 2004, and has led many of its initiatives to position it as one of the of the largest, most resilient and successful voluntary direct membership regulating Law Societies internationally. Among the key reforms during his tenure has been the lead role played by the Society in the move to a national legal services market in Australia. A current key focus is leading the Society to respond in its service offering to the forces of innovation, disruption, technology change and artificial intelligence.

Michael Tidball also serves as Secretary-General of LAWASIA.

Michael Tidball serves as a Director of Lawcover Insurance Pty Ltd and LawCover Pty Ltd as well as of LAWASIA Holdings. He also serves on the Board of Management of Quality in the Law, and is a member of the Council of the Francis Forbes Society for Australian Legal History.

Mr Tidball has a strong and active interest in classical music and serves as Chair of the Board of The Song Company, Australia’s leading and internationally highly acclaimed classical vocal ensemble. He is currently completing post graduate studies at the Saïd Business School at The University of Oxford, and is a Fellow of the Australian Institute of Company Directors.

jobs.companyName: The Law Society of New South Wales

      firms operating within NSW and other states.

jobs.jobTitle: Head of Legal - Risk Management & Workouts
jobs.description:
Responsible for dealing with complex issues that were presented to the Westpac Group, with a focus on material and non-business-as-usual matters, including assisting with the presentation and handling of those matters at senior executive level. 

The role continually evolved to meet the needs of business partners and customers in a constantly changing environment. Key responsibilities included:

    -  Partnering with senior management in the risk management division and business units to provide pro-active strategic and commercially-focussed legal advice to address business needs, manage issues and promote the interests and strategic objectives of the Westpac Group.

    -  Providing input and assistance to senior executives on complex strategic projects or transactions, including developing solutions which straddle legal and commercial thinking.

    -  Proactively engaging with internal stakeholders to assist with the implementation of sound business practice and operating process improvement.

    -  Management of, or involvement with, commercially sensitive reviews.

    -  Providing input and assistance on complicated ‘big ticket’ matters which have the potential for adverse financial and/or reputational ramifications - with the aim of maximising recovery and preserving customer relationships. 

    -  Assisting senior executives with Group Executive briefings and Board / Board Committee papers.

Key clients include Board and Board Committees, Group Executives, Divisional General Managers and  Divisional Heads.

Advising Westpac on variety of corporations law matters including mergers and
      acquisitions, asset sales and joint venture work, equity offerings, share and option
      plans (including executive remuneration arrangements and contracts), corporate
      
      governance and strategy, statutory reporting, contract law, secretariat mat

During my time with Gilbert + Tobin, I advised both listed and unlisted companies on a
      variety of Australian corporations law matters including mergers and acquisitions,
      asset sales and joint venture work, contract law, corporate strategy and governance,
      
      capital reductions and ASX listing rules issues and compliance.

Joined the corporate finance and mergers and acquisitions division of Herbert Smith in London as an assistant solicitor in 2001. 

Advising both UK and international clients (both private and publicly listed companies) on a wide range of corporate and corporate finance matters and in particular, mergers and acquisitions, joint ventures (including formation of and exits from international joint venture arrangements), limited partnerships, advising listed plcs and unlisted companies on circulars and equity offerings, private equity investment, loan and financing arrangements, corporate insolvency work (both transactional and advisory), general commercial agreements and a variety of day-to-day corporate advisory work.

Signicant transactions during the period include:

-  Rotch Property Group in relation to its £400m bid to acquire the entire UK NCP car park portfolio from The Royal Bank of Scotland.

-  PwC Consulting on the separation of its worldwide management consulting business and subsequent $3.5 billion sale of the consulting business to IBM.

-  TXU Europe Group on the £1.37 billion sale of UK gas and power supply business to EON PowerGen.

-  Farnsworth Group / Rotch Property on the sale and leaseback, restructure and disposal of Hilton hotels for £335.7 million to HBoS.

-  Chancerygate Group in connection with the acquisition both of a portfolio of properties beneficially owned by CRP Limited Partnership for £130 million.

-  JER Partners in connection with a joint venture arrangement with Grosvenor Property Group for the £25m acquisition and redevelopment of Belgrave House, London.

-  Argo Interactive Group plc on its refinancing by way of private equity investment and a POS Regulations rights issue.

-  Georgica plc on the acquisition of Megabowl Group Limited structured by way of a vendor placing 

-  Lonmin Plc on a court approved reduction of share capital to return £250 million to its shareholders.

- Institutional and private equity investments.

- Management buy-out and private limited company mergers & acquisitions.

-  Business start-ups.

-  Advising on the appointment of liquidators.

-  Commercial court work.

-  Commercial leases and sale of bank commercial premises.

general.headline: Managing Associate (Projects & Development) at Allens
general.description:
I am a projects and development lawyer based in the Perth office of Allens. My practice encompasses all aspects of engineering, building and construction law, including advising a wide range of clients in relation to construction, engineering, infrastructure and project financing. 

I have acted for various project participants, including sponsors, financiers, developers and contractors, in Australia and throughout the Asia region on major projects. I have experience in identifying and advising on legal risk, preparing documentation and negotiating on behalf of participants in the resources, energy and power, oil and gas, infrastructure and transportation sectors. 

I have also previously advised in relation to construction and engineering disputes.

jobs.description:
As a construction, projects and development specialist, I advise project companies, sponsors, contractors, banks and export credit agencies on a wide variety of project matters in connection with the energy, infrastructure, oil and gas and petrochemical sectors in Australia and throughout Asia Pacific.

I have particular experience in connection with EPC, EPCM, EPCI, D&C, O&M and all forms of construction and development agreements, including the Australian Standards and FIDIC suites of contracts, in respect of large-scale engineering and infrastructure projects.

My recent experience includes:

- Advising Multiplex on the landmark Quay Quarter development in Sydney
- Advising AWE on the arrangements for the development of the Waitsia gas field
- Advising Hastings Technology Metals on the development of the Yangibana rare earths project
- Acting for First Solar on the construction and O&M arrangements for the Beryl solar PV farm

As a Senior Associate in the Energy, Infrastructure and Projects team based in Singapore, I advised project companies, sponsors, contractors, banks and export credit agencies on a wide variety of project matters in connection with the energy, infrastructure, oil and gas and petrochemical sectors in Asia Pacific and particularly SE Asia.

This experience included:

- Advising the financiers in relation to the Tsetsii Wind Farm in Mongolia
- Acting on the construction and financing of Pengerang Terminal II at the RAPID development in Johor, Malaysia
- Advising the Project Company in relation to the Nam Theun 1 hydropower project in Laos
- Advising Long Son Petrochemicals on the development of its proposed petrochemical complex in Vietnam

As a Senior Associate in the Energy, Resources and Infrastructure Group, I advised on
      non-contentious engineering, building and construction law, including large scale
      
      infrastructure and procurement matters.

I undertook a five month secondment as legal counsel for AngloGold Ashanti.
      AngloGold Ashanti is a global gold producer with 20 operations in 10 countries and is
      the managing joint venturer of the Tropicana Gold Project, comprising a gold mine,
      
      on-site ore processing facility and power generation facility.

As a member of the Projects, Infrastructure and Construction Group, I acted on
      contentious and non-contentious construction and procurement matters, providing
      legal advice, contract negotiation and preparation of documentation.  I also advised in
      
      relation to construction and engineering disputes.

We provide comprehensive consulting, training, coaching and rigorous analytics to implement strategies to help leading listed and private organisations create demand and increase profitable, sustainable revenues. Revenue Storm accelerates revenues for its clients in 44 countries and nine languages.

As a senior business performance consultant with rogenSi form 2007 through to 2011, Wayne developed and delivered a wide variety of business performance improvement initiatives including Presentation, Negotiation, Influencing, Facilitation, Mindset and Sales Leadership. Wayne specialised in executive leadership and coaching, executive communication training, organisational sales development, change management and pitch coaching.

Wayne worked with rogenSi clients on high-stakes pitches, organisational sales development and training assignments across a wide range of industries but with a particular focus on the Financial Services sector, delivering real, measurable improvement to bottom line sales performance for clients.

In September 2006 PlanTech was acquired by IRESS Market Technologies Ltd at which time the company employed more than 80 staff and provided the acknowledged market-leading software products and services to more than 6,000 clients in Australia, New Zealand and South Africa.

G.O (SCUBA), Club Mediterranée (Maldives).

Developed computerised record keeping of student progress and reporting procedures in junior science and senior chemistry. Designed templates for computerised reporting procedures suitable for use by various faculties and incorporated into a whole school reporting scheme.

general.description:
Rob is a highly experienced lawyer practising in the areas of estate planning, trusts, taxation and personal financial structuring for high net worth individuals.

Rob has, for many years, been a partner of and continues as a consultant to DLA Piper (formerly Phillips Fox) where he worked in the Corporate Department on a variety of business, corporate and transactional matters.

Rob established his specialist practice in July 2013 because DLA Piper was focusing on cross-boarder and major transactional activities.  Many of DLA Piper's private clients have followed Rob into the new firm and the practice is also growing through referrals and recommendations.

Allen & Associates is located in Bourke Street, Melbourne (opposite RACV) and across the road from the DLA Piper building (where Rob continues to have an office).

Prior to rejoining private practice in 1990, Rob was the General Counsel for the listed multi-national Nicholas Kiwi Limited Group for nine years and prior to that, worked in a specialist commercial law firm focusing on trusts, tax, and commercial licencing.

Outside of work, Rob is married to Margaret and has two grown sons, Nicholas and Hamish.  Nicholas has followed Rob into the law but to his continuing angst ! deals with commercial litigation.  Hamish's focus is computers.

general.description:
I bring richly diverse professional and personal life experiences to my work as a criminal lawyer. I have an excellent track record with client satisfaction. I am warm, dependable and give 100% to everything I do. 

In my previous career as a photographer I was engaged by criminal lawyers as an expert witness. This work involved studying briefs, recreating and deconstructing crime scenes, analysing photographs tendered as evidence and preparing forensic reports. My love for the law was ignited and the rest is history. I apply the same "the Devil's in the detail" approach to my lawyering and work hard to ensure my clients feel strongly represented.

I assist the Law Society of NSW with their high school mock trial competitions & relish the opportunity it brings to see passionate, young upcoming advocates in action. I also act as a moot judge for the University of Newcastle Legal Centre.

general.headline: Special Counsel at Carroll & O'Dea Lawyers
general.description:
I work principally in the areas of Family Law, Conveyancing and Wills & Estates.
I am a nationally accredited mediator and an approved Family Dispute Resolution Practitioner (FDRP} and a collaborative lawyer.
Part of my philosophy of practicing law is aptly demonstrated by the following quotes:
Mahatma Gandhi:
"I realised that the true function of a lawyer was to unite parties driven asunder. The lesson was so indelibly burnt into me that a large part of my time during the 20 years of my practice as a lawyer was occupied in bringing about the private compromises of hundreds of cases. I lost nothing thereby - not even money; certainly not my soul." 
Abraham Lincoln
"Discourage litigation. Persuade your neighbours to compromise whenever you can. Point out to them how the nominal winner is often the real loser - in faces, expenses and waste of time. As a peacemaker, the lawyer has a superior opportunity of being a good man." 
I have been working as a lawyer since 1975, initially in Scotland and since 1984 in NSW.
When I started working in Newcastle, I was employed as a litigation lawyer.  I very quickly realised how disastrous the court outcomes could be for the parties, particularly where there was a relationship that needed to be preserved, eg between parents or between parents and child, or between siblings in a contested estate matter.  
What I went looking for was an approach that would optimise the well-being of the people involved in each legal matter and acknowledge the importance of concerns beyond simply strict legal rights. 
The underlying idea behind mediation and collaboration is that it generally offers a more resolution-based approach, which can heal rifts and which is healthier for clients, healthier for lawyers and ultimately healthier for society.

Specialties: Accredited Specialist Lawyer
Nationally Accredited Mediator
Accredited Family Dispute Resolution Practitioner

general.headline: Associate Solicitor at Go To Court Lawyers
general.description:
Kathryn holds a Bachelor of Communication with Distinction, a Bachelor of Laws and a Diploma of Legal Practice from the University of Newcastle. 

Committed to staying on top of the newest developments in the law for her clients, Kathryn is currently completing a Masters of Applied Law (Family Law) through the College of Law. Kathryn is admitted as a Solicitor to the Supreme Court of New South Wales. 

Kathryn is experienced in both the private and public sectors assisting clients with criminal, traffic and civil law matters. She has worked on a number of high profile matters including the application by Kathleen Folbigg for judicial review of her criminal conviction. Kathryn has researched and written in a number of areas of law including forensic procedures undertaken by the NSW Police. 

Before becoming a lawyer, Kathryn worked extensively with charity groups and sat on the Board of Directors of the Peter Hughes Burn Foundation. In this role, Kathryn learnt the value of good support networks in times of adversity. As a lawyer, Kathryn takes her role as her client’s advocate very seriously – ensuring her clients come through difficult times in the best possible way. Her aim is to provide clients with the highest quality representation in a cost effective way. 

In her spare time, Kathryn is actively involved in animal rescue. She can often be found near the beach being walked by her blind rescue dog or at home being bullied by her entitled rescue cat.

Jason appears in both the local and district courts of NSW including regional courts.  He also appears in the NSW Industrial Relations Commission for applicants and respondents.

Jason is briefed by the NSW Legal Aid Commission and the NSW/ACT Aboriginal Legal Service to appear in hearings, trials, appeals and sentencing.  He is also briefed by private law firms based in the Hunter Valley, Newcastle, Lake Macquarie, Tamworth, the Central Coast  and Sydney.

He has also appeared as junior counsel at the NSW Independent Commission Against Corruption (ICAC).

He has recently appeared as counsel at the national Royal Commission into Institutional Responses to Child Sexual Abuse.

Jason continues to offer advice to police officers who have been subject to reviewable notices under the Police Act 1990.

Jason offers advice on investigations, policy and procedures in the regulatory area.  He also conducts reviews of investigations for government and non-government agencies.  His reviews are impartial and procedurally fair.

Jason has experience in workers compensation law, personal injury law and criminal law. He has appeared before local courts in NSW and the Workers Compensation Commission.  He has represented clients in the Special Commission of Inquiry into matters relating to the Police investigation of certain child sexual abuse allegations in the Catholic Diocese of Maitland-Newcastle.  He has experience in small claims, debt recovery, commercial disputes and appeals in the District Court of New South Wales.

During 2010 and 2011 Jason was a prosecutor attached to Serious Non-Compliance at
      the Australian Taxation Office.  In addition to reviewing briefs of evidence and
      authorising the issuing of court attendance notices Jason was responsible for
      
      representing the Commissioner of Taxation in local courts across NSW.

general.headline: CEO & Co Founder at AgriDigital, Agtech, Fintech, Blockchain, Digital Trust, Speaker & Mentor
general.description:
Emma is a co-founder of AgriDigital and as CEO leads all aspects of the business' strategy, stakeholder engagement, blockchain and talent management with oversight of the sales, broader technology and operational environments. In May 2016 Emma led the AgriDigital team (formerly known as Full Profile) to a winning pitch at the BlockHack16 in Sydney, Australia demonstrating a working agri-blockchain and again in June 2016 at the Australian Blockchain Summit. In September, 2016, AgriDigital became the first agtech company to demonstrate at Finovate Fall, the world's leading fintech conference; launching its platform for agri supply chains.

With a diverse professional and executive career, Emma a deep understanding of the challenges faced by senior executives, CEOs/founders and boards in driving personal and organisational performance.

In her board roles, Emma plays a key role in the development and execution of organisational strategy paired with a keen sense of operational excellence and a commitment to stakeholder communication.

As coach and mentor, Emma supports start ups and early stage teams to get from idea to production, enhance their individual and team effectiveness and build an inclusive customer-centric culture.

Emma's collaborative style and excellent communication skills allow for easy engagement with teams and individuals. An "out of the box" thinker, she is comfortable with fast-paced environments as well as the challenges particular to mature industries.

Emma has an MBA, LLB (Hons), BA. is a graduate of the Australian Institute of Company Directors, an associate of the CreatingWe Institute of ANZ and a member of the International Coaching Federation. She is an in demand speaker at Blockchain, AgTech, Fintech, Supply Chain and Start Up conferences around the world.

jobs.description:
AgriDigital develops software solutions for the agri-sector that bring transparency,
      efficiency and trust to farmers and the post-farmgate ecosystem including commodity
      buyers, storage providers and other supply chain participants. We provide end to end
      transactional management for our grain supply chains and are exploring opportunities
      such as novel supply chain and grower finance and solutions for the cotton and
      
      livestock industries.

Emma is a co-founder of Full Profile and as CEO leads all aspects of the business' strategy, stakeholder engagement, blockchain and talent management with oversight of the sales, broader technology and operational environments including project management & delivery, marketing & communications, legal, company governance and culture.

Full Profile develops software solutions that bring transparency, efficiency and trust to agri-commodity supply chain management. Full Profile's leading product is agridigital, designed as a global and cross commodity agri supply chain platform that allows all participants in the ecosystem to act with confidence. 

Founded by industry experts with combined 70+ years of agri-experience, at Full Profile we are client focussed and committed to the needs of our key customer groups: brokers, buyers, site operators and growers. With an initial focus on the Australian grains industry our first broker system launched in April 2016. The launch of agridigital in October 2016 now means that buyers, site operators and growers in the grains industry have access to cost-effective leading agri supply chain software that puts them back in control of their business.

Full Profile plans to expand into the livestock industry in 2017 as well as in to the Canadian grains market. Alongside our agridigital platform we are developing a blockchain solution for the agri supply chain that addresses 3 key problems: (1) that farmers do not get paid for what they deliver when they deliver exposing them to unacceptable counter-party risk, (2) buyers cannot get the supply chain financing they need to pay sellers on delivery and (3) consumers don't know where their food really comes from. We are committed to solving these problems and de-risking the agri-supply chain for all participants.

Emma M Weston provides executive, organisational and personal coaching to CEOs/founders, senior executives and boards. Focussed on developing creative and empowered leadership, we also offer group facilitation and board and executive team coaching and reviews. 

Areas of focus include leadership development, "managing up" for senior executives and CEOs, intra-board and intra-executive team performance and the particular challenges faced by CEO/founders and the start up community.

emmamweston.com

jobs.description:
Emma is an associate of The CreatingWe Institute of Australia & New Zealand and is accredited in Conversation Intelligence™ (C-IQ™) and its related tools and methodologies. 

The CreatingWe Institute Australia & New Zealand provides leadership and associated management consulting services that deliver cultural transformation. Within our services we incorporate Conversational Intelligence™ (C-IQ™) neuroscience based tools and materials developed by world renowned organisational anthropologist, Judith Glaser. 

We are the “go to” provider of CI-Q™ based cultural transformation services in Australia and New Zealand. We assess the particular needs of our clients and their businesses, and we design solutions to meet those needs. In designing those solutions, we customise the CI-Q™ tools and materials to ensure that our offering is directly relevant.

Our emphasis is on enabling cultural changes within an organisation that will have the effect of altering day to day behaviours to unlock the potential within the organisation and help it to achieve its goals.

CreatingWe (Australia & New Zealand) is a licensee of The CreatingWe Institute™ operated by Benchmark Communications, Inc., which can be found at www.creatingwe.com. Benchmark Communications, Inc has authorised us to use instructional materials and methodologies of The CreatingWe Institute™ in the delivery of our services.

Agfarm is a Australia's largest independent grain broker and provides grower and brokerage services in grain and cotton for multiple buyers and sellers. Agfarm brokers small and large volumes of grain in a cost effective manner for its 3500+ grower clients. As a professional link in the supply and service chain, Agfarm provides growers amazing marketing choice and information, adding real value to their bottom line.

Agfarm's head office is in Sydney; regional offices are located in NSW at, Dubbo, Moree Wagga Wagga and Young; Horsham in Victoria and Freemantle in WA. Agfarm handles all major grains, with special expertise in wheat, barley, sorghum, canola and grain legumes.

Founded by Bob McKay in 1992, Bob and Emma Weston grew Agfarm from one small country town office to a national operation by 2008 at which time they sold 51% of the business to listed agribusiness Ruralco Holdings. In August 2013, Bob and Emma sold their remaining minority shareholding to US grower cooperative and Fortune 100 company, CHS. Bob and Emma stepped down from the board of directors and Bob will remain with Agfarm as its CEO.

Provided business development, strategic and operational advice to the Board and

Featherston Resources Limited (FRL) is a manufacturer of high grade natural fertilisers and soil conditioners under the trademark and brand name Adveco®. The key ingredient in FRL’s products is diatomite with high levels of silica and carbon/organic matter, including humates and fulvates, mined at FRL’s diatomite mine in the South Island of New Zealand. FRL exports crude diatomite and agricultural inputs. FRL's Adveco® fertilisers and soil conditioners are slow release, moisture retentive and can be applied across all horticulture and agricultural crops, in all soil types.

general.headline: Co-Founder | Co-CEO | Civic Ledger
general.description:
Through Katrina's early years as a sociologist through to her interest in entrepreneurialism, she has extensive experience in public policy and early stage commercialisation.  For more than 20 years, Katrina has worked in both public and not for profit sectors with a specific focus on business development, project delivery and revenue diversification with the view to building resilient and sustainable organisations.  

In Australia, she organises Women in Blockchain events and regularly speaks on the topic of why cities and governments should be exploring blockchain technologies.  Katrina's interest in blockchain technologies is driven by her curiousity of its potential for governments to create and facilitate new citizen-at-the-centre markets, organisations and economies of the future.

jobs.description:
As a Program Mentor I am responsible for mentoring online students to successfully
      achieve course competency outcomes. As an industry knowledge and skills expert, I
      facilitate learning and student success by guiding, motivating and engaging students
      through appropriate mentoring approaches. As a Mentor I emphasise the practical
      application of blockchain concepts and methodologies to drive the development of
      industry-relevant skills and employability. I also provide direct career advice based on
      
      the students’ course and career goals.

I bring my many years of experience in public sector regulated marketplaces to my role with Civic Ledger by helping our clients understand the possibilities of blockchain technologies.

Civic Ledger is an civictech focused Australian startup that uses blockchain technologies to transform a wide range of business process challenges faced by public sector marketplaces.  Our purpose is to make peoples transactions with government easier, faster, more secure and transparent.

Our approach is to build blockchain applications with market fit in mind by working with government clients and customers to drive the use cases and the development of the platform.  We intentionally work with governments rather than to the exclusion there of because we want to deliver on blockchain’s potential and build viable solutions that improve people’s interactions with government for the longer term.

Our applications and solutions use blockchain and smart technologies to enable citizens and customers to self-manage the speed, convenience, and control over their transactions with government resulting in reduced time, cost and risks enforcing regulatory compliance over entitlements.  Our specialisms include:

Blockchain Based Issuance, Registries and Distributed Trading and Exchange Platforms:

Civic-commodities blockchain based registries and distributed exchange platforms to create new digital marketplaces for citizens to self-serve and self-manage entitlements such as permits, licences rights and tickets.

Sustainable-commodities blockchain registries and distributed based exchange platforms to increase the transparency of sustainable commodities trades such as water, carbon, energy and precious resources.

Blockchain Professional Services
•	Advisory and bespoke blockchain based applications
•	Insights to real world problems in the public sector regulated markets
•	Develop blockchain based applications to solve these problems

The openCoLab is a collaborative cooperative platform joining up people and organisations to leverage skills, experiences and capabilities.  Leveraging is the new sharing.

We work with organisations, communities and individuals to create new social and economic systems, business models and services using blockchain technology and associated decentralised applications.  

Our mandate and manifesto is to show and share – to not only imagine; but bring to life a better future.

We work on things that matter – because it matters.

iSpruik is a Start Up | Inside Outside Enterprise | Social Good | Design Thinking | Disruptors | RAOK in a world gone social. Shifting from pipes to platforms, from B2B to H2H; iSpruik is about connecting the seemingly unconnected to create magic and change the world.  Curious and open to blockchain technology to explore possible applications for the frictionless management of one's own digital identity within decentralised smart networks.

iSpruik specialisms: CONNECT | ENABLE | AMPLIFY

My area of expertise is raising external revenue with in excess of 15 years’ experience  working in business development, proposal and bid management roles across a broad  section of work environments and industries.  

It is with this experience together with my passion for solving complex business problems that I bring to iSpruik.

I enjoy working with organisations to explore new value propositions, revenue streams, alternative cost structures, supply chain configurations and customer relationships by designing and delivering innovative solutions to help them grow by transforming the customer experience.

Key influencers: Steve Jobs (humanities meets technology), Fasial Hoque (Everything Connects),  Sangeet Paul Choudary (Platform Scale), Primavera (founder at Backfeed.cc) and Melanie Swann (Institute for Blockchain Studies).

iSpruik is a company committed to decentralised digital humanitarianism.  Come follow us!

Due to the vision of past Directors and staff, the Foundation's owned and managed a commercial portfolio compromising of a chain of Op Shops and a Call Centre and Lottery Management Services business - the former trading for 25 years and the latter coming up to 40 years in 2017.  

In collaboration with key people the commercial portfolio undertook a transformation to place the customer at the centre of the value proposition to bring a strong focus on establishing more integrated relationships with the Foundation's assets – the supporters.  In addition this position was responsible for establishing strategic partnerships to support the expansion of programs and services to people with asthma.

general.fullName: Heidi Alexandra Joy - Inspiring New Human Leaders
general.headline: MBA Advisory Board  at University of Newcastle
general.description:
Well hello there delicious human! How nice of you to pop by my little profile, how do you do?
And while I'm in question asking mode...how do you do work? How do you do life? How to you create, compose and connect?

I believe the future belongs to the creators to those who ask questions and take nothing for granted. The past favoured science, logic and reason but the future is geared to the creators - those who wield great creativity, emotion and intuition. Those who tune in, switch on and tap into their humanity, who know what it means to truly be alive. 

In my spare time when I'm not wandering a sunburnt country in my tiny house The Joy Box, I help executives and business owners who are frustrated with the people stuff, to transform their workplace culture into one where their people feel creative, useful and productive. 

We all want meaningful work that allows us to use our UNIQUE STRENGTHS and talents, to create our own path and future every day. Which is why leadership matters more than ever. Leaders are responsible for setting the direction and the environment within an organisation. To grow a great company, a leader must begin by recognising the importance and human power of their people. 

I've seen first-hand the strong link between poor leadership, toxic cultures and the absence of employee engagement. I’ve seen what doesn't work and I've worked with those who get it right. Work can and should be fun and healthy.

If you're a leader ask yourself:
How do I give feedback and hold one-on-ones that are significant? 
How do I get beyond the words and show up day-to-day as a coach not a micromanager? 
How do we create the space needed for personal growth while raising, our culture standards?
How alive do I feel? 
How alive do my people feel?

If you want to transform your team or company, attract brilliant talent and create future growth through your human power, then let's connect. Reach out in person or booki an appointment here www.calendly.com/uqpower
general.lastName: Alexandra Joy - Inspiring New Human Leaders

general.headline: Partner, Employment and Workplace Relations at Swaab

jobs.description:
Michael Byrnes is a workplace relations lawyer with over 20 years' experience in assisting clients navigate employment and work health and safety issues. 

He provides advice on all aspects of the employment relationship including the hiring process (terms of employment, contract negotiation and drafting, modern awards and enterprise agreements), day-to-day operations (anti-discrimination and diversity, sexual harassment, bullying, performance and conduct, managing illness and injury, industrial disputes, work health and safety) and termination of employment (unfair dismissal, adverse action/general protections, confidential information and post-employment restraints). Michael runs specially tailored training programs and seminars for clients (including at board level). He also drafts and reviews workplace policies and undertakes complex and sensitive workplace investigations.

Michael is an experienced advocate who has appeared in various courts, tribunals and commissions in both interlocutory and final hearings on matters including breach of employment contract, statutory underpayment claims, industrial disputes, unfair dismissal hearings, work health and safety plea hearings and coronial inquests. 

He also has extensive experience in the employment law aspects of corporate transactions such as mergers and acquisitions and corporate restructures.

As well as regularly presenting at conferences, Michael is often called upon for expert opinion in the media. He has appeared on numerous radio segments and quoted in publications including The Australian Financial Review, The Age, ABC News, Lawyers Weekly, Workplace Express, OHS Alert, SmartCompany and InTheBlack on workplace relations and WHS law issues. Michael is also co-author of the LexisNexis publication "Annotated Fair Work Act & Related Legislation".

general.headline: Managing Director - Hayden Mobile Testing
general.description:
HAYDEN MOBILE TESTING now covers ALL OF NSW 

I am very excited about our mobile service for On-site Testing, our business is growing every day and I really enjoy being able to empower businesses to meet their WHS obligations when it comes to D&A, Audio and Spiro testing.  

Hearing Loss in the work place is a major when it comes to Workers Compensation Claims, we suggest to all of our clients to carry out regular audio testing at a minimum of every two years as per the code of practice and wherever possible to have an exit test conducted when staff are leaving.  This ensures that if an industrial deafness claim is ever lodged you will reduce the amount of the claim liability because you have clear evidence and reports from continuous monitoring to prove the hearing loss was not caused (or minimal) whilst employed.

We are also able to conduct noise assessments, every 5 years as per the Code of Practice or when new machinery is introduced to the workplace.

If you would like to know more about our services and how we may be able to assist your company please contact me anytime on 0403 428 523 or visit our website www.haydenaus.com.au

general.headline: Director at Australian Business Lawyers
general.description:
I have over twenty five years experience advising clients on their interests in property law, acting for individuals, businesses and joint venture relationships.

Property has been the centre of my legal practice and the leasing relationship is my main focus.  With the benefit of experience in drafting agreements right through to litigating disputes, I have developed a practical and commercially astute approach to helping clients across a wide range of areas involving  leasing, complex property development and joint venturing property relationships. 

My experience in property includes leasing (commercial, industrial and retail) for both the landlord and tenant; dispute resolution of conflicting interests (of all kinds) in property, preparation of joint ventures for the development or co-ownership of land; financing and securities; conveyancing and incorporation of multi dwelling communities like aged care, retirement villages, strata and community title schemes; compliance with various tax or revenue laws (GST, CGT and/or Stamp Duty) in property transactions.

On a personal note, I enjoy drawing, art, ocean swimming and winter swimming, competing in surf competitions (mainly beach sprints), golf and am a Patrol Captain at Clovelly Surf Life Saving club.

general.headline: Associate Director at Australian Business Lawyers & Advisors (ABLA)
general.description:
Kyle is an Associate Director in the Workplace team at Australian Business Lawyers & Advisors, based out of its Newcastle office. 

As a senior member of the Workplace team, Kyle assists clients to manage complex workplace issues, providing pragmatic and commercially minded advice aimed at mitigating legal risks and allowing clients to make business decisions with confidence.

Kyle’s practice is a mix of advisory work and litigation. Where matters turn litigious, Kyle represents clients in a range of courts and tribunals and manages the conduct of those matters from commencement to final hearing. Kyle has considerable experience representing clients before the Fair Work Commission, the NSW IRC and the Federal Circuit Court in particular. 

Kyle also conducts workplace investigations for both private and public sector clients where the matter is particularly serious or complex and warrants an external investigation. 

In addition to his advisory and litigation work, Kyle regularly presents training sessions to private and public sector clients (both to HR managers and the broader workforce) on a range of topics such as bullying, discrimination and harassment, performance management, merit appointment and others. 

In 2018, Kyle was recognised by Doyles Guide as a rising star in the area of Employment & WHS.

jobs.description:
Australian Business Lawyers & Advisors (ABLA) is an incorporated legal practice that is a wholly owned subsidiary of NSW Business Chamber. This puts ABLA in a unique position for a legal practice. As a mission based business, we focus on your business success and deliver commercially appropriate solutions to resolve your problems. 

​We focus on representing and advocating for business. With no partnership structure, the team collaborate and co-operate together, both within our practice teams and across the firm.

We work differently to other practices

● Our foundation is built on driving the success of businesses like yours.
● You get the right people for the job, with the best minds to get the best outcome.
● Our focus is not just on the present, but we strive to protect your organisation from future legal mishaps.  
● We get to know your business; we come to you.
● We educate your team as we go, which minimises future risk.
● We play to our strengths of acting for businesses, so you get simple explanations, using business language and business-focussed outcomes.

​Our motto is: experts make things simple

Simple is the delicate art of making complicated subject matter easy to understand. It’s the difference between confounding you with complexities, and keeping you informed about the key legal issues that matter.
 
Because our priorities are different to other firms, our reasons for coming to work are different. We work in an atmosphere of mutual respect and collaboration, which translates into how we work with you.
 
Our customers say we’re a ‘breath of fresh air’ – and you’ll feel the difference from the first phone call.

Clayton Utz is a leading top-tier Australian law firm providing expert legal advice in a wide range of industries.

Clayton Utz's national Workplace Relations, Employment and Safety team advises public and private organisations across all workplace related matters including employment, industrial relations, occupational health and safety, discrimination and diversity, privacy and corporate laws.

In 2013, Clayton Utz was named "Firm of the Year - Australia" in the inaugural Who's Who Legal 100, which identifies the world's top 100 law firms.

Harmers Workplace Lawyers is one of Australia’s largest employment and industrial law practices with offices in Sydney, Melbourne and Brisbane.
 
Their diverse client base includes many of Australia’s most prominent companies (both listed and private), employer associations, media personalities and senior executives. The firm also has a significant pro bono scheme, consistent with its charter to ensure fairness in the workplace.
 
Harmers Workplace Lawyers has attracted significant recognition for both legal excellence and people management practices, winning Employment Specialist Law Firm of the Year at the ALB Australasian Law Awards on seven occasions (2006 to 2011, and 2013).

general.headline: Barrister at New Chambers
general.description:
I have 24 years' experience in complex commercial litigation.
I have been a barrister for 14 years.  I believe that advocacy is a skill and an art. I am passionate about exploring and continuously improving my performance as an advocate.  I have built an advocacy learning website (advocacyhub.com.au) in which I publish articles on effective advocacy based on interviews with leading advocates.
I specialise in insolvency, intellectual property, corporate & commercial, property and construction litigation - but my practice covers pretty much everything in the commercial space.  My clients brief me because of our professional relationship, how we work as a team, the effectiveness with which we conduct matters together and how I perform in Court.
I coach other barristers in advocacy.  Since 2012 I have taught at the Australian Bar Association's advanced trial advocacy intensive each January, for experienced barristers.  I have also taught at equivalent courses in South Africa and Singapore.  I also coach new barristers twice a year at the Bar Practice Course and lecture at the course.
Before I came to the Bar I was at Allens for 10 years. I have a background in accounting and was at Arthur Andersen & Co for a year as a graduate in 1988.  My understanding of accounting and finance serves me well in many of my cases.

general.headline: Barrister-at-Law (Attorney), Inspirational Author & Huffington Post Blogger
general.company: The International Society for the Reform of Criminal Law
general.description:
Jehane commenced university in 1988 in Psychology, graduating in 1991 with a Bachelor of Science and then in 1992 with a Post-Graduate Honours Degree in Psychology (Class 1).

With a keen interest in the human psyche, Jehane commenced her law degree in 1993, graduating in 1995 with her Bachelors in Law with Class 1 Honours, with her thesis on the place of psychopathy in criminal law. 

Jehane then worked at Sparke Helmore (in local government and property) from 1995 and completed her College of Law Graduate Diploma of Legal Practice with Distinction.

In 1996 Jehane was admitted as a solicitor and continued at Sparke Helmore, before moving to the Office of the Director of Public Prosecutions (DPP) in 1998. In 2002 Jehane became a Professional Assistant to the DPP for NSW at that time, Mr Nicholas Cowdery AM QC. In this role she gave legal and policy advice on a number of serious and complex areas of criminal law, practice and procedure.

When the opportunity arose in 2003 to become counsel assisting to Mr Peter Bodor QC in an inquiry for the Commissioner of Police, she took up the role with enthusiasm. After being admitted to the roll of Barristers in 2004, she continued in that role until the report was tabled in Parliament.

Jehane has since practised as a criminal law barrister. She has appeared in the Local, District, and Supreme Courts, Chief Industrial Magistrate’s Court, Court of Criminal Appeal, High Court, Independent Commission of Corruption, Crime Commission, Mental Health Review Tribunal, NCAT, the NSW Coroner's Court, State Parole Authority, and the CTTT.

Not only is Jehane an accomplished and experienced lawyer, she is also a Huffington Post Blogger and Author known as Gigi G. She published her book "The Glass Is Full: The secrets to being happy and staying happy" through Balboa Press (a division of Hay House Publishing in the USA) and has appeared on Australian TV and as a guest speaker and host on live radio in the USA, Canada and Australia.

jobs.companyName: The International Society for the Reform of Criminal Law
jobs.description:
The International Society for the Reform of Criminal Law is an international non-governmental association of judges, legislators, lawyers, academics, and governmental officials who have come together to work actively on the administration of criminal justice both in their own jurisdiction and internationally. 

In addition to many and various important functions internationally, the Society participates as a professional organization in the work of the United Nations Crime Prevention and Criminal Justice Program through the International Scientific and Professional Advisory Council.  Members of the Society have participated in numerous UN meetings.

The Society has also been accorded observer status on crime problems by the Council of Ministers of the Council of Europe.  The Society's participation in the work in the Council in this area provides criminal justice policy makers in Europe with another valuable link with their counterparts in the jurisdictions in which the Society has members.

For more information about the work of the Society, see the website at http://www.isrcl.org/

As a Young Justice Professional Member of the Society, Jehane's role is to engage in research for the Society at the direction of the Board of Directors.

general.description:
I am an Associate Professor at the TC Beirne Faculty of Law, University of Queensland and studied at ANU, Oxford and Columbia. I have previously taught at law schools in Canada, Hong Kong, and Australia as well as practising extensively as a solicitor and barrister. 

While at the Sydney Bar from 1994 to 2005 I specialized in property, banking, insolvency, and general commercial disputes. I appeared in several leading cases in the High Court of Australia including Reid v Howard (1995) 184 CLR, Garcia v National Australia Bank (1998) 194 CLR 395, Tanwar Enterprises Pty Ltd v Cauchi (2003) 217 CLR 315, and Palgo Holdings Pty Ltd v Gowans (2005) 221 CLR 249.

My main academic interests and writing focus on real and personal property, banking and finance law, evidence and procedure, insolvency, and equity and trusts.

John Bui is admitted as a solicitor in the Supreme Court of NSW and the High Court of Australia. He completed a Bachelor of Law and a Bachelor of Business (Finance) from the University of Technology Sydney.

Throughout John’s years of practice as a solicitor, he has worked on a variety of legal matters in the areas of litigation, dispute resolution, bankruptcy and insolvency, probate, property disputes, child custody disputes and criminal matters.

Having an advanced knowledge with practise and procedure in the Local, District and Supreme Courts of NSW, the Federal Courts, the Family Court of Australia and other Tribunals, John is able to provide passionate and quality advice.

He has worked alongside some of the most talented and impressive legal minds in Australia on complex and high-profile litigious matters. Where a particular matter requires it, John is able to utilise his expansive contact base to assist in providing the right solution for you.

He believes the winning lawyer is often the one who commands the most facts and works the hardest. To this end, John has been building a reputation based on personal attention that he provides.

He prides himself in being able to skilfully educate, negotiate, mediate or litigate to protect the interest of clients.

His passion drives him to achieve the best outcome in any and all matters, whether small or large.

jobs.description:
We are a boutique law firm that set our practise apart by measuring our success not from turnover but from client satisfaction. 

We offer clients service that combines the high quality expertise and experience of a large corporate firm with the individualized attention and accessibility of a small firm. An affordable alternative to top-tier firms while providing the same or better standards . We use ingenuity & creativity to best address our clients' needs and work to rigorously achieve their goals. 

When possible, we work to achieve the best possible settlement without litigation. When that is not possible, we will pursue your claim zealously in the courtroom. 

There are many law firms in location filled with lawyers and solicitors who can competently deal with your legal issues and give you adequate legal advice. 

But sometimes you need more than just competent and adequate. 

Here are some reasons why our clients continually choose us: 


- Guaranteed call back within 4 working hours. 
- Costs agreements so that you know how much you’re up for before we begin the work. 
- Extended and after hours consultations – we know you’re just as busy as we are. 
- Mobile service – we’ll meet you wherever is convenient including at home, in hospital and at your office. 
- Family friendly appointments – we’re happy if you bring the kids along. 
- Jargon free legal advice. 
- Environmentally friendly services – we’re a paper free office and are determined to continue to decrease our carbon footprint. 
- A network of professional services including Barristers, Accountancy & Business Advisory, Mortgage Brokers, Real Estate Agents, Taxation, Financial Planning, Valuation and Surveyor services, and Interpreter services. 

If you are looking for lawyers who make a positive difference, call us today. There's only one way to find out.

Contact us today:

T +61 2 9723 8080
E enquiries@jbsolicitors.com.au

general.description:
Deborah has over 20 years exclusive experience in Family Law and is an accredited family law specialist and trained in collaborative practice.  Deborah opened a successful boutique legal practice, D A Family Lawyers, in May 2005. Deborah's vast experience consists of:

•	Binding Financial Agreements
