Deborah is also a nationally accredited mediator and a registered family dispute resolution provider.

Deborah is also on the panel of Independent Children’s Lawyers and Separate Representatives, which enables her to be appointed by the court to represent the interests of children in court proceedings in the Federal Magistrates and Family Court of Australia and the Children’s Court of Queensland.
Deborah appears regularly in the Federal Circuit Court of Australia, Family Court of Australia and the Children’s Court, often as a Solicitor Advocate, avoiding the need to retain separate counsel. Deborah often appears as Town Agent for other law firms on both a private and Legal Aid basis.
Deborah regularly participates in private  mediations and round table conferences.

Deborah was the President of the Family Law Practitioners Association (FLPA) in 2011 and 2012, is on the Professional Conduct Committee of the Queensland Law Society and was a  previous  member of the Executive of the Family Law Section of the Law Council of Australia. Deborah served as Vice President of the Queensland Law Society in 2014 and 2015.

general.description:
Bruce is a former president of the Queensland Law Society (2011) and a former director of the Law Council of Australia, the peak body for lawyers in Australia (2010 - 2012). He is an Accredited Family Law Specialist and a former president of the Family Law Practitioners Association (Qld).  

Bruce is a family lawyer in private practice with a strong interest in access to justice.He co-chaired the organising committee of the successful Third Annual Australian Access to Justice Pro Bono Conference in Brisbane in 2010.  

Bruce has experience and interest in family law matters with international issues. He has presented on Australian family law at conferences in India, Korea and Japan.

Bruce was admitted as a solicitor in Queensland in 1983 and in 2013, he established Doyle Family Law, a specialist family law practice of which he is a Legal Practitioner Director. 

Bruce is a former deputy president of the Children Services Tribunal.  He has also been a senior case officer with the Child Support Agency. 

Bruce is a mediator, arbitrator and collaborative lawyer.  He is an author and contributor to professional publications and a presenter, commentator and chair at legal education events in Australia and overseas.

Specialties: Family Law, International family law matters, Child Support, Child Protection, Mediation, Arbitration, Collaborative Law

general.headline: Barrister at Law and Mediator
general.description:
I am a general commercial barrister practicing in Brisbane. Over the past few years I have expanded my practice as a barrister to include the role of mediator. 

I was admitted as a barrister in 1989. To date, I have conducted over 150 mediations as mediator and I have appeared as a barrister representing plaintiffs, defendants, insurers or third parties in over 300 mediations. I have participated in one capacity or another in mediations involving disputes covering many areas of law including a wide variety of commercial matters, personal injuries, wills and estates and further provision applications, insolvency, construction and professional negligence. I have acted as a mediator in Farm Debt mediations held pursuant to the Queensland Farm Finance Strategy.

I am an accredited mediator with the Bar Association of Queensland in accordance with the Australian National Mediation Accreditation System. I am an approved mediator for both the Supreme and District Courts having previously completed a Bond University mediation course. I have presented papers on mediations at Legalwise seminars every year since 2010.

general.headline: CEO at The Mediation Experts
general.description:
The Mediation Experts is an alternative dispute resolution organization with a team of professionals who assist parties to resolve disputes/conflict and/or issues efficiently, quickly and effectively without the stress, expense and unknown result of litigation. The Mediation Experts assists parties in identifying and explaining their issues, exploring the issues, discussing options and seeking a mutual resolution. Areas of expertise include Family Law, Workplace, Commercial, Construction, Estate, Real Estate, Business, Personal Injury and others.


Farley S. Tolpen is the founder and CEO of The Mediation Experts. Farley is a mediator and lawyer with over 30 years experience mediating, arbitrating and litigating. Dual-qualified in both Australia and the United States and a member of the California State Bar and Queensland Law Society, Farley is also a registered National Mediator and certified Family Dispute Resolution Practitioner with over 3000 mediations to his credit. Farley believes in the real-world efficiencies and effectiveness of mediation and has a 90% success rate in resolving disputes/conflict.

general.headline: Accredited Family Law Specialist, Mediator, Collaborative Lawyer & Podcaster, Author, Speaker at Happy Lawyer Happy Life
general.description:
Clarissa Rayward is known as ‘The Happy Family Lawyer’ as she specialises in helping couples stay out of Court and work together to reach a resolution to their relationship breakdown. A practising family lawyer, she is the Director of the Brisbane Family Law Centre, a multidisciplinary practice where lawyers work alongside counsellors and financial planners to ensure that clients receive the holistic support they need.

Clarissa is the author of the successful ‘Happy Family Lawyer’ blog, providing weekly commentary and tips on issues relating to life, love, relationships and divorce. She is also the Author of the book, ‘Splitsville – How to separate, stay out of Court and stay friends.’ 

In 2016 Clarissa launched her new venture ‘Happy Lawyer, Happy Life’ in response to the growing number of lawyers and other professionals reaching out to her looking for ways of finding ‘Happiness’ in their careers. Clarissa’s podcast and book both titled ‘Happy Lawyer, Happy Life’ offer insights and resources for legal professionals seeking fulfilling careers and happiness both in law and in life.

Due to the overwhelming response to her book and podcast, Clarissa has also launched two new initiatives to support and assist lawyers in their professional lives: “The Course” and “The Club”.
Clarissa was recently recognised for this innovative platform, receiving the 2017 LexisNexis and Janders Dean Legal Innovation Index Award for “The Club”, an online community for entrepreneurial lawyers looking to make the best out of their career while making the best of their lives outside of the law.

For her continuing groundbreaking innovative ideas and projects, Clarissa was recently further acknowledged by the legal profession, receiving the 2017 Women Lawyer’s Association of Queensland’s Inaugural Trailblazer Award.

jobs.description:
Helping you navigate relationship breakdown amicably with fixed price, tech based
      
      solutions for couples all over Australia.

In 2016 Clarissa launched the Podcast, ‘Happy Lawyer, Happy Life’ in response to the growing number of lawyers and other professionals reaching out to her looking for ways of finding ‘Happiness’ in their careers. Clarissa’s podcast and book both titled ‘Happy Lawyer, Happy Life’ offer insights and resources for legal professionals seeking fulfilling careers and happiness both in law and in their life outside of the law.

Specialist Family Lawyer, Presenter and Author, Clarissa Rayward is also known as 'The Happy Family Lawyer'. Clarissa specialises in helping separating families stay out of the Family Courts and stay friends as she believes that a divorce can be part of a marriage you can look back on with pride. 

Clarissa is the Author of the book 'Splitsville-How to separate, stay out of Court and Stay friends'. 

Every 30 minutes an Australian child will experience the separation of their parents. Australian studies consistently show that children who experience divorce are at risk of poorer outcomes in adult life than their peers who have not experienced family breakdown.

Clarissa considers it essential that family lawyers, do all we can to ensure that the next generation of adults do not suffer as a result of the separation and divorce of their parents.

"My goal is to change the way families experience divorce and separation and to do this, I will be known for changing the way family lawyers practice family law."

jobs.jobTitle: Director and Accredited Family Law Specialist, Mediator & Collaborative Lawyer
jobs.description:
BFLC is a boutique Family Law practice based in Brisbane with a focus on resolving family law matters without the need to go to Court.
Central to our approach is our focus on collaborative practice- A form of conflict resolution involving a problem solving team who agree to disclose all information and negotiate in a constructive manner without resort to litigation or the threat of litigation.  Brisbane Family Law Centre is one of the first specialist collaborative law firms in Australia.  
Each of our clients have their own individual experience of divorce.  We are able to tailor creative solutions as we provide a fresh, sincere and personalised approach to your divorce settlement.

Ma Belle Amie opened in October 2010 as a labour of love and an escape from Clarissa's 'other life'​ as a family lawyer.  Ma Belle Amie is a French inspired cafe and gift store.  It is a beautiful place for a quiet coffee with friends or somewhere to grab a last minute gift. Ma Belle Amie closed its doors in June 2015 to allow room for Clarissa's new business venture due to launch in 2016.

general.headline: Legal Virtual Practice | Virtual Chambers | Disbursed Legal Practice | Legal Solutions for Corporate and Commercial Law
general.description:
► What I do?
▬▬▬▬▬▬▬
Teddington was established by Mark Gardiner in 2009, to create an environment that provided front end marketing support with a back end administration, finance, knowledge and technology platform that lawyers could easily plug into. In a sense, so lawyers could go into business for themselves without having to set up or run a business.

In 2012, I joined forces with Mark to further grow the Teddington model and I’m really proud that we have a diverse network of lawyers who represent a diverse range of communities including Korean, Chinese, African and Bangladeshi. The network services both domestic and international clients across a range of industries. 

I’m passionate about enabling lawyers to break free from the law firm constraints and realise their potential where they control their destiny whilst doing what they do best - providing legal solutions.

► About Teddington Legal:
▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬
Teddington is a boutique law firm that specialises in the provision of legal solutions and advice to businesses and their owners.

If your business has clients, employees, suppliers and or property and assets, Teddington can help with the preparation of effective structures, advice, documentation and contracts to mitigate potential risk and establish robust legal frameworks to support your business goals.

► What we offer:
▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬
Legal Virtual Practice ✔ Virtual Chambers ✔ Disbursed Legal Practice ✔ Legal Solutions for Corporate and Commercial Law ✔ Law Practice Growth Specialist ✔ Business Law & Commercial Advice ✔ Property & Real Estate Law ✔ Employment Law & Workplace Relations ✔ Immigration Law & Investment Visas ✔ Litigation & Dispute Resolution ✔ Virtual Lawyer & In-House Counsel 
✔ Corporate Governance & Compliance ✔ Work Place Investigation

jobs.description:
► About Teddington Legal:
▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬
Teddington Legal provides legal solutions to businesses and their owners - delivering commercially focused advice and solutions. Teddington provides a unique environment for experienced lawyers to run and operate their own practice under the Teddington brand. Freeing them up to focus on client experience and allowing the head quarters to take care of the administrative functions that prove challenging for all business owners. In this "virtual chambers" approach to a law firm both the client and lawyer benefit from the sturcture.

► What I do?
▬▬▬▬▬▬▬
I am the current MD & CEO of Teddington Legal bringing a range of corporate disciplines and processes to this unique firm.

It is my desire to develop and lead a diverse network of talented lawyers to provide commercially sound, outcome-focused legal solutions to businesses and their owners.

My purpose is to create an environment where entrepreneurial lawyers can provide great value, pragmatic, commercial legal solutions to the SME sector. This environment supports the desires of lawyers looking for freedom, flexibility and control over their financial future.

Operating from a feminist, social justice perspective we work to improve the spectrum of policy, legislative and program responses to domestic and family violence (DFV) and to eliminate DFV through leadership in advocacy, partnerships and the promotion of good practice.

GCD Exhiitions also have an in-house Sign Shop producing high quality pull up banners, and pop up banners as well as all signage required for exhibition clients, shop and office fit out requirement and advertising agencies.

general.headline: Lawyer & Founder of The Legal Eagle.com.au
general.description:
LOOK! 
UP IN THE SKY...IT'S A LAWYER WHO DOESN'T BILL...................................................................
Hi, I run a fabulous website called 'The Legal Eagle'.
http://thelegaleagle.com.au/

The site offers free legal information and solutions on consumer disputes; problem neighbours; divorce and separation and preparing a will. 
Oh... and it's all FREE.  Yep, it truly is fabulous!

I also occasionally write on legal issues for websites like Mamamia. 
I have also written for law journals. 
 
I live a happy minimalist life and figure it's a lot more enjoyable giving than receiving, particularly as so many people just can't afford legal assistance, or even understand the law.

Send a request with a note if you would like to connect, I no longer take random requests.
Cheers, 
Mark

general.headline:
Barrister, Mediator, Arbitrator and 
CEO of SHAW DR
general.description:
**Finalist at the 2018 "Mediator of the Year" Australasian Law Awards. **

** Finalist at the 2018 "Mediator of the Year" ADC Awards

Since establishing SHAW Dispute Resolution, Alison has progressed her own personal legal career by taking the next step up to the bar.  Alison has joined Mitchell Chambers and will undertake the bar readers course in 2019.

As the Chief Executive Officer of SHAW Dispute Resolution, Alison has a passion for helping people resolve their disputes without courts!  The business is now set up and growing offering dispute resolution by mediation and arbitration as well as work place investigations nationally.

In addition Alison is a nationally accredited mediator under NMAS and Registered FDRP.  She completed her national accreditation with Bond University in 2011, and a Graduate Certificate in Mediation at the University of South Australia in 2014.  Her RMAB is the Law Society of SA. She has previously trained in Collaborative Practice and has been a Mediation Workshop Facilitator for the Law Society for South Australia and AIFLAM (Australian Institute of Family Law Mediators and Arbitrators). 

Alison has been appointed on the panel of mediators for the Magistrates Court of South Australia, ReturnToWorkSA and the Office of the Franchising Mediation Adviser.

Alison has a passion to work with you to help resolve disputes within your business whether it be through Workplace Mediation, Workplace Investigations, Consultancy or Coaching. 

A former foundation Equity Partner at BBS Lawyers and Mediators, Alison has over 19 years of experience in the legal profession, with a Double Degree in Law and Arts from the University of Adelaide and Specialist Accreditation as a Family Law Specialist with the Law Society of South Australia. Alison also has an MBA degree from the University of South Australia.

jobs.jobTitle: Barrister, Mediator, Arbitrator and CEO of SHAW DR

jobs.description:
At SHAW Mediation Australia, I have the opportunity to focus on mediation. After many years of negotiation and litigation as a lawyer, I am now able to help more people resolve their disputes their way using mediation saving business and people time, money, relationships and reputation. I am referred mediations by Return to Work SA, the Adelaide Magistrates Court, HR managers, accountants, lawyers, barristers and former clients; and have performed mediations in family law disputes about property settlement and parenting arrangements, return to work arrangements between employers and employees, franchise disputes and neighborhood disputes. 
I have set up this mediation business to help people resolve their disputes - commercial and personal, quickly, conveniently and cost effectively.

I am mediating all types of disputes - commercial and personal, at any location, any

In 2009 together with Andrew Barnes and Della Brinsley we established Barnes

general.headline: Professor of Corporate Law and Governance
general.description: Professor Michael Adams is an internationally recognised specialist in corporate law, governance, securities markets regulation, and legal education (especially e-learning). Michael has been writing, teaching and regularly presenting on all these topics for over 25 years. He is a Fellow of the Australian College of Educators (FACE), as well as the Australian Academy of Law (FAAL), and is also a Fellow of the Institute of Chartered Secretaries and Administrators, Australia (FCIS). Professor Adams was President of the Australasian Law Teachers Association and a former President of both the Corporate Law Teachers Association and Chartered Secretaries Australia. He is the co-author of ten books and 30 chapters, 100 articles and over 200 conference/seminar presentations. In 2000 he was the recipient of the Australian University Teacher of the year for Law and Legal Studies.

jobs.jobTitle: Dean of the School of Law and Professor of Law
jobs.description: I am the Dean of the Law School (which is 20 years old), which is based at the Parramatta campus and Campbelltown campus of Western Sydney University (previously UWS). There are approximately 50 fulltime staff and 50 part-time academics, looking after 1,800 law students and 3000 business law students. Known for social justice (Parramatta Community Justice Precinct) in law degree and research excellence in corporate social responsibility (CSR) and sustainability/environmental law.

ALTA has over 1,000 members who are law teachers in Australia and New Zealand at
      universities. I was elected on to the ALTA Executive in the mid-1990s and became Chair
      in 2005 and later President when hosting the ALTA annual conference in July 2009 for
      
      UWS Law School. I still serve as Immediate Past Chair.

jobs.description: This was a sponsored chair (professorship) in addition to my role as Professor of Corporate Law at UTS. It required me to work each Thursday at Perpetual (a leader in financial services in Australia). The work involved advising the general counsel and company secretary on governance issues, as well as corporate law and financial services matters. Some staff training of the lawyers and writing briefs and reports, as well as management presentations etc.

Helped clients and lawyers within Blakes with fianncial services law issues and
      inparticular the link between corporate law directors duties and superannuation trustee
      
      issues.

Taught and reserached corporate law issues, inparticular directors' duties and
      
      securities markets regulation.
Led the Australian professional body CSA with the CEO.

The CLTA was formed out of the ALTA "Company Law Interest Group" as company law (state based) became the Federal (Commonwealth) corporate law in 1991. UNSW ran the first conference, followed by Uni of Canberra and then QUT. In 1994 I hosted the CLTA conference at UTS and formed the CLTA, with Prof Paul Redmond as President and myself as Secretary. In 1998-1999 I became the third President:
http://www.clta.edu.au/about/governance.htm

general.headline: Associate Director specialising in Family & Relationship Law at Mullane & Lindsay Solicitors in Newcastle

jobs.description:
Ashleigh joined our firm in 2007 and is an Associate Director in our Family & Relationships Law group. She is a NSW Law Society Accredited Specialist in Family Law.
She practices primarily in family law property and parenting matters, and has a particular interest in parenting and children’s matters.
Ashleigh is a Steering Committee member of the Greater Newcastle Family Law Pathways Network - which is an interagency of family service providers in the Newcastle and Hunter region – and was the Chairperson of the Network from 2012 to 2015.  She has been an active member of the Network since 2007.  Her involvement in this Network keeps Ashleigh up to date with the workings of other post-separation services - both private and government organisations – with whom separating parents come into contact.
Ashleigh is a committee member on the Hunter Valley Family Law Practitioners’ Association, and was Secretary of the Association from 2011 to 2015.
Ashleigh also appears in Apprehended Violence Order (AVO) proceedings and criminal law and traffic matters in the Local Court.
Ashleigh has strong ties to Newcastle having completed her Law degree and practical legal training at the University of Newcastle in 2006. She is a former Youth Mayor of the city, a position she held for seven years. Ashleigh also holds a Bachelor of Communication, with a major in Public Relations, from the University of Newcastle.
Ashleigh is a member of the Family Law Section of the Law Council of Australia, the Law Society of New South Wales, the Newcastle Law Society,  the Hunter Valley Family Law Practitioners’ Association and the Hunter Young Professionals Network. She is also a member of the Newcastle & District Softball Association Judiciary.  She has previously been involved with the Newcastle Law Society’s Young Lawyers sub-committee.
She is admitted to the Supreme Court of New South Wales and is entered on the High Court register of practitioners, and is entitled to appear in all federal courts.

jobs.companyName: Hunter Valley Family Law Practitioners Association
jobs.description:
Ashleigh held the position of Secretary of the Hunter Valley Family Law Practitioners' Association for 5 years.  She remains on its committee.

The Hunter Valley Family Law Practitioners Association is compromised of family law practitioners practising in the Newcastle Registry of the Family Court and Federal Circuit Court, with members from Newcastle, Lake Macquarie, Hunter Valley, Central Coast, and as far afield as Queensland and southern NSW.

jobs.companyName: Greater Newcastle Family Law Pathways Network
jobs.description:
The Greater Newcastle Family Law Pathways Network is an inter-agency of family law service providers working together to achieve the best outcomes for separating families.  

Members of the Network include representatives from government agencies such as Department of Human Services - Centrelink and Department of Human Services - Child Support Agency; mediators and counsellors and lawyers.

Ashleigh has been involved with the Network since 2007.  She has been a member of its steering committee since 2010. She has been the Chairperson of the Network since July 2012.

general.headline: Director at Mullane & Lindsay Solicitors

jobs.description:
Michael joined Mullane & Lindsay in 2002 and is a Director in our Commercial & Property and Estate Law group.

Michael's work focuses on commercial, property and estate transactions and associated issues including residential and commercial property transactions; business sales and purchases; commercial agreements; wills and estates including succession and estate planning as well as other general commercial, property and estate related transactions and their taxation implications. He also has an extensive practice in commercial and retail leasing.

Michael believes in building a long term relationship with his clients and works closely with their other professional advisers, to provide a fast and efficient service that delivers a business as well as a legal outcome.

Michael has an excellent understanding of practical business issues, having worked for 8 years in the retail sector prior to completing a Bachelor of Economics and then a Bachelor of Law (LLB) and Diploma of Legal Practice. This included completion of the highly acclaimed legal professional program at the University of Newcastle Law School. Michael's prior experience in the 'real' world of business helps him provide practical and relevant advice to our clients.

general.headline: Senior Solicitor specialising in Wills and Estates at Mullane & Lindsay Solicitors
general.description:
Specialist practice areas: deceased estate administration, deceased estate litigation and estate planning.

I am a Senior Solicitor in Mullane & Lindsay's Commercial, Property and Estate Law group. My practice is primarily focused on estates law, particularly the areas of deceased estate administration, deceased estate litigation and estate planning. I also have experience in retirement village leasing, residential property transactions and general commercial agreements.

I am currently completing a Masters in Wills and Estates through the College of Law to further my expertise in the area of estates.

I joined Mullane & Lindsay in early 2013 after completing a Bachelor of Commerce and a Bachelor of Laws & Diploma of Legal Practice at the University of Newcastle. My experience in the law during my studies was varied, having worked with Legal Aid, Aboriginal Legal Service, in house counsel for a private company and a commercial law firm.

I work primarily from Mullane & Lindsay's Newcastle office, however I am also the solicitor responsible for the firm's branch office at Gwandalan. 

In addition to my role as a Senior Solicitor, I am Mullane & Lindsay's Privacy Officer. In this role I am responsible for overseeing development, implementation and assessment of practices and procedures consistent with obligations under the Australian Privacy Principles. I am able to advise clients in relation to their privacy obligations and assist in compliance with these obligations.

I am a member of the Law Society of New South Wales, Newcastle Law Society and Hunter Young Professionals. 

I am also the editor of A Gen Y Perspective - a blog dedicated to providing a fresh perspective on the law and making the law more accessible to the community. You can find my blog at  http://agenerationyperspective.wordpress.com/ 

You can contact me at lana.black@mullanelindsay.com.au.

general.headline: Partner at Madison Marcus Law Firm
general.description:
Benoir is an accomplished young lawyer with experience well beyond his years. 

Benoir was admitted a lawyer in February 2014. Benoir predominantly practised in commercial dispute resolution with a particular focus on property and construction litigation. During this time, Benoir also worked on corporate and commercial transactions, intellectual property protections and general commercial drafting.

Benoir acted for and advised clients on disputes in multiple jurisdictions including NCAT, the Local Court, the District Court, the Supreme Court, the Federal Court and the Court of Appeal on matters relating to a wide range of equitable and common law issues. The value of these disputes ranged from $50,000 to $150 million. 

Benoir was promoted to Associate in 2016 where his focus practice area transitioned to purely corporate and commercial matters relating to mergers and acquisitions, corporate governance advice, asset protection and extensive commercial drafting. 

Benoir was promoted to Partner in 2018 and the leader of the Mergers, Acquisitions and Corporate Division at Madison Marcus. In this position, Benoir acts for a large number of high net-worth individuals, small and medium size enterprises and large corporations on a variety of legal transactional and advisory matters. 

Benoir has advised advised on the completion of a restructure of material sale transaction to an ASX listed corporation with a net value exceeding $100 million. Other notable matters Benoir has acted on include the sale of interests in NSW landholding entities with sale values ranging between $50 million and $200 million. Benoir has also acted on the acquisition and disposal of assets and shares in technology, child care, real estate and other internationally diverse businesses. 

Benoir was a finalist at the 2018 Lawyers Weekly Australian Law Awards in the category of Dealmaker of the Year. 

Benoir is personable and quick to identify resolutions to complex legal problems.

general.headline: Accredited Specialist Family Law, Senior Associate at Marsdens Law Group
general.description:
Marsdens Law Group History:

Marsdens Law Group was founded by John Marsden as a one man practice in 1968. Since he started the firm, John set high standards of service, professionalism and commitment. It was these standards and John's voracious appetite for work and innovation that saw the firm expand, at times rapidly, to become one of the largest firms in the State.

In that time the practice has grown from a one man, one secretary operation to a firm with almost 150 staff and 4 offices located throughout the Sydney Metropolitan Area.
The firm has been successful because it understands that Our Clients Come First.

Marsdens are not simply your average law firm. We provide our clients "Service with a Difference".

Marsdens offer many other services which include:

Commercial Law

Commercial Litigation Law

Compensation Law

Criminal Law

Estate Planning

Family Law

Local Government & Environmental Law

Property Law

www.marsdens.net.au

schools.schoolName: The Law Society of New South Wales
schools.description: Specialist Accreditation is a structured peer to peer assessment process enabling legal practitioners to be recognised for their expertise. To be an accredited specialists the lawyer must pass a series of meticulous assessments on both legal knowledge and its application in practice. To retain their accreditation, specialists must undertake significant additional professional development in their area of expertise each year.Specialist Accreditation Chair, Richard Harvey, said:“Specialist Accreditation is held by less than 6% of the profession here in New South Wales. We are proud that Specialists Accreditation is such a rigorous process and getting accredited is just the start. When a specialist retains their accreditation year on year their clients know the value of the advice they receive.”

general.headline: Accredited Specialist in Family Law, Managing Associate at Armstrong Legal
general.description:
Since graduating with a Bachelor of Laws and Bachelor of Commerce from the University of Wollongong I have completed post graduate studies, including my Masters in Applied Law (Family Law) and have become an Accredited Specialist (Family Law). I am also trained in collaborative law and am able to represent children as an Independent Children’s Lawyer.

Previously working at a regional general practice firm has given me knowledge and experience in the areas of conveyancing, crime, wills and estate planning. This has assisted me working in family law, that is inherently a varied and complex area of law. My understanding of these diverse areas of law, experience in dealing with other parties, attending mediations and litigating at court, puts me in a position to provide my clients with realistic advice of the likely outcomes and cost estimates.

I have a real passion for helping people with their family law issues.

general.headline: Family Lawyer
general.description:
In brief:
I have been a lawyer specialising in Family Law in Sydney for last ten years.  

The longer version:
I joined Marsdens Law Group as a Law Clerk before being admitted as a solicitor in 1994.  Initially working in Commercial and Property Law I moved into Family Law over ten years ago, becoming first the manager of that practice group and then Partner.  Family Law at Marsdens is now one of the largest parts of our diverse legal practice across four offices througout Sydney and the Greater West.  Our practice is fast growing and is characterised by dedicated compassionate and effective family lawyers.  We aim to provide a consistently excellent service.

Specialties: Advocacy, negotiation and advice in Parenting and Property disputes, mediations, divorces, maintenance  and child support matters.

Worked as a student volunteer at the legal centre prior to graduation.

general.headline: Senior Associate Lawyer at Marsdens Law Group | Legal Advice | Legal & Public Advocacy
general.location: Oran Park, New South Wales, Australia
general.description:
I am a Senior Associate Lawyer with Marsdens Law Group and President of the Macarthur Law Society, practising in all areas of family law, property and conveyancing, commercial and estate planning, heading-up our firm's new Oran Park office in the Macarthur region.

I have come to appreciate that every client and their circumstances are unique. Navigating the legal system is a daunting prospect for most people, so by focusing on understanding my client's individual needs I am able to advise them on the best and most appropriate legal avenues available to them. 

I regularly appear in Court as an advocate before the Federal Circuit Court of Australia and Family Court of Australia, and am skilled at negotiating amicable settlements for clients through formal negotiation or mediation processes.

Having grown up in the Macarthur region, I am keen to contribute to the development of the legal professional and business sectors through my work with the Macarthur Law Society, the Greater Narellan Business Chamber, Western Sydney University as well as the Law Society of NSW and NSW Business Chamber.

general.headline: Partner in charge of Commercial Litigation Department, Accredited Speacialist in Advocacy
general.description:
The Basics:

Grant is the Partner in charge of our Commercial Dispute Resolution and Insolvency Departments. Grant has been with Marsdens since 1996 and partner since 2001.

Grant's practice focuses on complex contractual, Australian Consumer Law and Insolvency litigation. Grant has been involved in numerous important decisions.

Grant was awarded a Master of Laws Degree from the University of Technology, with a major in Commercial Law, in 2001 and a Master of Business Law from the University of Sydney in 2006.

Grant is accredited by the Law Society of NSW in the area of Advocacy. He is an Associate Member of the Insolvency Practitioners Association of Australia. He is a Lecturer in Equity and Trusts.

Grant is also actively involved in community affairs, being a past Director and President of the Campbelltown Chamber of Commerce and a member of the Macarthur Law Society.

Marsdens Law Group History:

Marsdens Law Group was founded by John Marsden as a one man practice in 1968. Since he started the firm, John set high standards of service, professionalism and commitment. It was these standards and John's voracious appetite for work and innovation that saw the firm expand, at times rapidly, to become one of the largest firms in the State.

In that time the practice has grown from a one man, one secretary operation to a firm with almost 150 staff and 4 offices located throughout the Sydney Metropolitan Area. 
The firm has been successful because it understands that Our Clients Come First. 

Marsdens are not simply your average law firm. We provide our clients "Service with a Difference".

Marsdens offer many other services which include:

Commercial Law

Commercial Litigation Law

Compensation Law

Criminal Law

Estate Planning

Family Law

Local Government & Environmental Law

Property Law

www.marsdens.net.au

general.headline: Solicitor specialising in environmental law, Aboriginal cultural heritage and native title
general.description:
I am a highly adaptive, approachable and passionate lawyer with diverse experience in the field of environment and planning law.

I advise clients in the energy, infrastructure and waste sectors and am keen to establish relationships with my non-legal peers.

In particular, my interests are in renewable energy, climate change, biodiversity, native title, Aboriginal cultural heritage, contaminated land, and waste issues.

jobs.description:
I advise Australian and international clients in the energy, waste and development
      sectors on cultural and built heritage, biodiversity protection and offsetting, pollution
      
      incidents, native title, and the management and rehabilitation of contaminated land.

jobs.jobTitle: Solicitor - Planning, Environment and Local Government
jobs.description:
I advised and represented individual and corporate clients and had daily carriage of
      matters in the Land and Environment Court of NSW, including appeals involving
      
      residential developments and compulsory acquisitions for infrastructure projects.

As a lawyer in the Litigation team, I prosecuted individuals and companies for regulatory breaches in relation to environment conservation, pollution and dangerous goods issues on behalf of the Office of Environment and Heritage (NSW) and the NSW Environment Protection Authority. These are the peak bodies in NSW administering environment protection legislation. 

Prior that, as a lawyer in the Legislation and Advice team I advised officers in various branches of the Office of Environment and Heritage (NSW) and the NSW Environment Protection Authority on issues relating to environment conservation, pollution, Aboriginal cultural heritage, European heritage and native title. I also prepared several legislation projects, including in relation to the transport of dangerous goods, and underground petroleum storage systems.
